intro: Chorilepis kingii, commonly known as the King's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. The plant features smooth, waxy leaves and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It is native to southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. Chorilepis kingii is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
